newsitem.title: JAPAN: BOJ governor quoted as saying Japan rates stable.
newsitem.headline: BOJ governor quoted as saying Japan rates stable.

text.p: Japan's short-term interest rates have been moving in a stable manner, Bank of Japan governor Yasuo Matsushita was quoted as telling cabinet ministers on Friday.
Matsushita did not make any specific references to the BOJ's overall assessment of the economy at the meeting, Economic Planning Agency Minister Shusei Tanaka told a news conference.
"The overnight call rate, three-month CD rates and savings rates have generally been moving in a stable manner," Matsushita was quoted as saying.
Reviewing the recent moves in interest rates, Matsushita said long-term interest rates have been falling since mid-July and are now hovering around 2.5 percent, Tanaka said.
